title: I loooovveee playing against champs like jayce.
body:
It's like playing against nidalee but with less interaction.

People think assassins are op now. I can't wait for siege/poke comps to come back and for people to really see how dumb they were for wanting assassins to be nerfed. 

Calling it now and I'll make another thread on how I was right.

The issue with jayce is that he is basically an assassin who can also siege really hard. Three crits with hyper charge deals ludicrous damage (especially if he got a Muramana). I'm glad they have a big nerf to hyper charge lined up for next patch.

I honestly think Jayce deserves a rework like Nidalee did. He needs to have reason to sit in his hammer form other than 'Oh, you're low from all my poke? Here let me hop over and smack you on the butt!' 

I'd just want to see more build diversity other than 'let's go Muramana into full armor pen AD nuker every game' because I never see Jayce build anything else.
To be fair I think everyone needs more build diversity.

Those are single, core items though. 1 item out of the 6 (5 really if we're excluding boots) for a champion's endgame build. Obviously Ryze wants mana, Akali wants the dumpster's worth of stats that Gunblade gives her. And Veigar wants DFG to drop a nuke on some unfortunate sod. 

With Jayce, there's really only one build that he ever bothers to use; Muramana to solve his mana issues, and then goes straight AD and armor pen with BC, LW, and Bloodthirster. Anything else, and you're really gimping yourself. 

This build emphasizes his cannon form so he's basically Xerath's AD counterpart. I really want there to be reason to build a bruiser / offtank version of Jayce that has him sitting in hammer form most of the time.

This isn't late Season 3, assassins only have a small edge right now due to the mana changes and the fact assassins are mostly manaless. That, and LeBlanc doesn't usually -need- to build mana regen but can anyway with a morellos and hits a powerspike while also gaining good waveclear/manaregen.

There's a weird conception about laning phase where people believe you're required to attack the enemy. You're not. All you have to do is farm, not die, and keep tabs on where an assassin is.
